question: भारत में मौलिक अधिकारों को न्यायालय द्वारा लागू किया जा सकता है। क्या अमेरिका में 'Bill of Rights' के अंतर्गत यही judicial enforceability की गारंटी होती है?

options.B: No, US Bill of Rights is not justiciable.
options.C: Yes, and even non-citizens have some rights enforceable.
options.D: Only the President can enforce rights in the US.

answer: Yes, and even non-citizens have some rights enforceable.

question: Right to Equality (Article 14) भारत में सभी के लिए है, परंतु क्या UK में ऐसा कोई codified fundamental right exist करता है?

options.A: Yes, under UK Human Rights Act 1998.
options.B: No, UK follows unwritten conventions only.
options.C: Only Parliament members enjoy such rights in UK.
options.D: UK courts do not recognize equality before law.

answer: Yes, under UK Human Rights Act 1998.

question: Article 19 में दिया गया freedom of speech क्या absolute है? अमेरिका में same freedom क्या 'clear and present danger' test से restrict किया जाता है?

options.A: Yes, both countries allow unrestricted speech.
options.B: No, India has more restrictions than USA.
options.C: Yes, India uses same test as USA.
options.D: India does not allow political criticism; USA does.

answer: No, India has more restrictions than USA.

question: Right against self-incrimination (Article 20(3)) India mein hai. Kya USA mein bhi koi similar protection hai?

options.B: No, forced confession is allowed in US.
options.C: Only in civil cases it applies in US.
options.D: Right to silence exists but not enforceable.

question: भारत में writ jurisdiction SC और HC दोनों के पास है। क्या UK courts writs जैसे habeas corpus जारी कर सकती हैं?

options.A: Yes, but only with Parliament's permission.
options.B: No, writs are not recognized in UK.
options.C: Yes, UK courts can issue traditional writs.
options.D: Only Supreme Court can issue writs in UK.

answer: Yes, UK courts can issue traditional writs.

question: Right to Constitutional Remedies (Article 32) को 'soul of Constitution' कहा गया। क्या US Constitution में aisa koi specific remedy clause hai?

options.A: No, remedies are left to state courts.
options.B: Yes, but only for federal cases.
options.C: No explicit clause like Article 32 exists.
options.D: Yes, every amendment has its own remedy.

answer: No explicit clause like Article 32 exists.

question: क्या Fundamental Rights automatically apply in private actions (जैसे private employers) India और USA दोनों में?

options.B: Only in USA, not in India.
options.C: No, generally they apply only against the State.
options.D: In India, they apply even on private citizens.

answer: No, generally they apply only against the State.

question: भारत में religion-based reservations allowed हैं या नहीं? क्या USA में भी affirmative action religion के आधार पर संभव है?

options.A: Yes in both, as long as it's for minorities.
options.B: No in both, religion-based policies are banned.
options.C: India allows religion-based quota, USA does not.
options.D: USA allows religion-based affirmative action, India does not.

answer: India allows religion-based quota, USA does not.

question: क्या UK में Fundamental Rights को amend करना भारत जितना कठिन है?

options.A: No, UK Parliament can change rights by simple majority.
options.C: Only Supreme Court of UK can amend rights.
options.D: Rights in UK are permanent and unchangeable.

answer: No, UK Parliament can change rights by simple majority.

question: क्या Directive Principles को enforce ना करना fundamental rights violation माना जा सकता है?

options.A: Yes, SC can force implementation of DPSPs.
options.D: DPSPs override Fundamental Rights if public interest demands.
